title: What to Give: Design Books - WSJ
text:
What to Give: Design Books Gems, labyrinths, stilettos and Sealyham Terriers. Ann Landi picks the best gifts for design buffs. Updated Nov. 18, 2016 6:16 p.m. ET 
In the purely fluffy category are two fun volumes of drawings by Lucy Dawson, “Dogs Rough and Smooth” and “Dogs as I See Them” (Harper Design, both 96 pages and $25). Who was Lucy Dawson, you wonder? She was a prewar British illustrator “known for her paintings and etchings of sporting dogs and other breeds.” These are quick, charming sketches in graphite and chalk, some little more than deft visual haiku of terriers, dachshunds and dalmatians. The artist’s droll notations bring the pups further to life: “Roy loves to get his teeth into an umbrella,” and Bustle shows a “partiality for cigarettes, which have to be...
